info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Pasquotank and southern Perquimans Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burgess, or near Hertford, moving east at 25 mph. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elizabeth City, Hertford, Winfall, Chapanoke, Burgess, Nixonton, Pasquotank, Rabbit Corner, Symonds Creek, Woodville, Okisko, Forestburg, Jacocks, Light Nixon Fork, Smithtown and Stevenson Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
